titleStmt.title: A godlie dreame compiled by Elizabeth Melvill, Ladie Culros younger, at the request of a friend.
titleStmt.author: Colville, Elizabeth Melvill, Lady Colville of Culros, fl. 1603.

editionStmt.edition: This text is an enriched version of the TCP digital transcription A07427 of text S1302 in the English Short Title Catalog (STC 17814). Textual changes and metadata enrichments aim at making the text more computationally tractable, easier to read, and suitable for network-based collaborative curation by amateur and professional end users from many walks of life. The text has been tokenized and linguistically annotated with MorphAdorner. The annotation includes standard spellings that support the display of a text in a standardized format that preserves archaic forms ('loveth', 'seekest'). Textual changes aim at restoring the text the author or stationer meant to publish.

respStmt.resp: This text has not been fully proofread

fileDesc.extent: Approx. 30 KB of XML-encoded text transcribed from 12 1-bit group-IV TIFF page images.

publicationStmt.pubPlace: Evanston,IL, Notre Dame, IN, St. Louis, MO

availability.p: This keyboarded and encoded edition of the work described above is co-owned by the institutions providing financial support to the Early English Books Online Text Creation Partnership. This Phase I text is available for reuse, according to the terms of Creative Commons 0 1.0 Universal . The text can be copied, modified, distributed and performed, even for commercial purposes, all without asking permission.

titleStmt.title: A godlie dreame compiled by Elizabeth Melvill, Ladie Culros younger, at the request of a friend.
titleStmt.author: Colville, Elizabeth Melvill, Lady Colville of Culros, fl. 1603.

notesStmt.note: Includes "A verie comfortable song, to the tune of Shall I let her goe?"
Imperfect: tightly bound, with print show-through.
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
